author: BITS
title: Why trauma informed practice makes a huge difference
body:
I contacted Eastwood AMHT recently to ask for a duty CPN to call me and I specifically requested a female return my call. The receptionist's response was that it would be whoever was available. I explained I needed a female staff member and that my care plan documents the reasons surrounding my request. I also said the call wasn't of an urgent nature and if there was no female available then it could wait till one was free. The receptionist said this would be passed on. I'd already made five calls including; my GP, NHSGGC, NHS Inform that morning in an attempt to identify a solution and plan to what I was wanting to speak to the CPN about. I fully appreciate and understand the overwhelming pressures the mental health team are working under.hence my trying to find an answer elsewhere. These previous calls had resulted in me ending up in tears and this call only served to further increase my distress.  
  
However, I have had similar experiences on multiple occasions with not only the Renfrewshire HSCP but various other healthcare services including NHS24, NHSGGC and worst of all the now obsolete crisis service;which has been replaced by NHS 24 Mental Health Hub and is somewhat of improvement but could still be better.  
I decided to draw this to your attention as I am aware that the HSCP is undertaking TIP training to hopefully become a trauma informed organisation. I have praised and commended this in a previous post on Care Opinion.  
Becoming a trauma informed organisation involves a huge shift in systems, processes and culture which require to be embedded throughout the fabric of the organisation; from the very top level to bottom for it work. It doesn't happen overnight but involves a journey with the leadership of an organisation playing the pivotal role and truly understanding and appreciating the value of working in this way and in fully committing by; enabling, empowering, resourcing and training all staff. In my opinion this most definitely should include reception and call handling staff who are the face and first point of contact for patients. They are so important,and often under appreciated, in setting the tone for all that will happen going forward and in many ways are intrumental in determining whether the patient will have a good or poor experience. Please be reassured the receptionist I spoke with in no way came across in this way and remained polite.  
I am trying to highlight just how very important I believe the role of call handler/receptionist is in setting the tone and making a patient feel listened to, understood and they will try to help in a person-centered way that works for the individual. For people with a history of trauma the most important element in TIP is helping them to feel ‘safe enough’ to engage with services, based on my experiences it is often the small things and paying attention to detail which can be the most helpful. I have lost count of the number of times I have hung up, refused to engage, or have any further contact with a service or professional solely as a result of the way the initial call was handled. Often this has had extremely negative consequences for myself and when just a more understanding and compassionate initial response would have helped me to feel able to engage.  
  
Conversley, a recent extremely positive experience I had a main reception staff member at Eastwood. This staff member exemplified how adopting TIP can make such a difference to a patient’s experience. Following a call to another AMHT receptionist, who again remained polite, but didn't seem willing to try to find a solution. I called main reception to ask for assistance to drop of an item for my Consultant. I explained I just can’t enter the health centre due to my fear of being around people and that people wearing masks are triggering for me. I’ve pretty much been a ‘prisoner’ in my own home for the past eighteen months. The staff member used their initiative and went out of her way to help to facilitate this and to find a way around my difficulties. They met me at the far end of the car park, away from the entrance, when I called to say I was outside, came out immediately to save me from waiting around and even had the foresight to ensure their mask was removed. This staff member was so lovely,empathetic,caring and understanding and I wish to thank them for helping me in this way. I don’t know if they realised they were working in a trauma informed way but it was definitely underpinned as such, in the way they interacted,communicated and related to me. Thank you.  
  
In my previous post I offered to help in any way the HSCP thought may be of beneficial to becoming a trauma informed organisation. I thought this may identify areas which you may want to look at. If you feel it would be helpful I would be more than willing to explain more fully and in greater depth as to how these very different interactions/communications with staff have on people who have experienced trauma and how it makes you feel and how it makes you react.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Disappointed Service User
body:
I have been with Eastglade since.2017 and have had four care coordinators which apparently is normal Eventually I was put in hospital and they discharged me when I was allocated a care coordinator - she told me to ‘ be a man and grow up’  this was not helpful to say the least. She then walked out after 10 minutes telling me that Home treatment would see me but failed to refer me to them. I have since been allocated a care coordinator who is a nice person, sympathetic and understanding but their hands are tied and although they do their best they are limited in what they can do. My care coordinator actually writes things down. In the past care coordinators have not recorded what I told them and just gone with their own thoughts.
Five times  I have been in hospital  because I have been suicidal and they have put me in the Crisis House and referred me to the Home Treatment Team who discharged me after one visit. Home Treatment is not a good description of this department.  On one occasion when Home Treatment came to see me I was told that ‘ I see people like you all the time you should man up. To use the term discharge is not helpful as it has very negative impact and because of this my mental health has been made worse. 
I feel as if I have been on a roller coaster with so many ups and downs and twists and turns that it has had a negative impact on my mental health . 
I regret ever having agreed to work with Eastglade as I am no better at all.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: ACCsurvivor
title: Not included in at risk group due to Adrenal Insufficiency
body: I have no adrenal function and so expected to be included on the at risk groups for COVID vaccination. Despite providing my GP with the Addison Disease Expert Endocrinologist opinion supporting this, my GP decided that I wasn’t entitled to an early vaccination. Apparently because my condition was caused by having had Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma (that I survived) he didn’t feel that it was necessary for me to be included in the early group as I no longer had cancer! I am still at risk of adrenal crisis but unfortunately it seems that my GP felt he knew better. Luckily I managed to avoid COVID and was eventually  vaccinated as a regular over 50 year old patient. GPs should not be able to play God and should have clearer guidance for rare diseases

author: inspiresx84
title: They supported my decisions
body: I have recently had my second daughter and was supported throughout my pregnancy by the South Aberdeenshire Community Midwife Team who were absolutely fantastic. They supported my decision to have a home birth, made sure I was properly informed of my decision and took time to answer all queries my husband and I had about the process. When it came to the labour, whilst it was extremely quick and not quite what I had planned, my Midwife Lindsay was excellent and got to me very quickly. She was calm and reassuring and completely non invasive and although she had been on shift for many hours by the time my daughter was born, accompanied us to Aberdeen Maternity Hospital after the birth and made sure I was supported and settled before leaving us. Since having my daughter the team visiting me at home have provided excellent feeding support and reassurance and I am so grateful to them all for their assistance. Thank you Lindsay, Claire, Rachel, Moira and Romana for all of your support.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: Nikki23
title: Friendly & professional
body:
What a fabulous, slick service the new TAU provides.  
Libby welcomed me to the dept. Reg Rod & the medical student were great.  
The radiologist was extremely efficient.  
Melinda & the staff were very friendly & professional.  
Unfortunately they confirmed a fractured wrist & sorted out follow up.  
Excellent service at my doorstep.  
Anne Marie & Jackie should be very proud of their staff!

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: venusbp46
title: Abdominal pain
body:
Went to a&e for severe abdominal pain.  
First nurse I saw was lovely and reassuring, got me some painkillers (albeit they were paracetamol so didn't help at all).  
Second nurse was dismissive and didn't read the notes the other nurse had written, so I had to explain everything again.  
The nurse then asked me if I had a smear test, to which I said no as I am only 20. I feel the staff member became huffy at this and told me I needed one. My age was on the top right corner of the computer but they kept insisting I need one.  
Also told me I should go on birth control even though it had nothing to do with the pain I'm in.  
Didn't bother doing any other tests, I felt like they wanted me out of there. Once my urinalysis showed it wasn't a UTI or pregnancy the member of staff informed me well it could have been a miscarriage or it could be endometriosis. Go to the doctors.  
I asked for painkillers, was told to just take paracetamol and ibuprofen, which I already told them I find they don't help.  
Left a&e stressed and in more pain than before, with no answers.  
3 hours I spent there and got nothing from it.

author: jackpotry83
title: Mirena coil change
body: I had my coil removed and a new one fitted. The staff were very nice and supportive through the whole appointment. Giving me time afterwards to settle myself before having to leave. I felt confident in their ability to complete the procedure and they made me feel as comfortable as possible.

author: Alihs63
title: Covid vaccination booster
body: I received an email and a text message last Thursday, telling me I could book my Covid jab booster.  I booked on-line, being able to choose an easy appointment which I could access before work today.  I arrived to a good welcome in the Leisure Centre car park, then someone with hand sanitiser, and arrived in a well-marked, and well-organised hall.  My vaccination took place within five minutes of the appointed time, and after my waiting for the requisite fifteen minutes, I was able to set off for work on time, leaving the car park with a cheery wave from the volunteer on duty.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Thankful from Keady
title: Wonderful Play Therapist
body: My Son was in the ward for a prolonged time, following an operation. Helen introduced herself to him, and when she did, he smiled for the first time! She has been so kind to us, and has lifted my sons spirits everyday! Bringing him toys, and inspiring him with crafts, Helen has been a wonderful support to my sons recovery process! In fact, in the evening he would be so excited to show Helen what he had made the previous day!! I know for sure, That Helen contributed to my sons improving mood and we could never thank her enough! Bless you Helen from Blossom Ward

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sagittariuswd89
title: CBT for Anxiety
body: I have had a really sad and rough last few years and didn't realise how anxious I had become because of this and how much this was affecting my life and day to day thinking and living.  I self-referred (by accident actually!) for help and support from Inclusion Thurrock and have just completed 3 months of CBT training with a wonderful Therapist called Kelly.  She was amazing and listened to me - no matter how small and insignificant my worries seemed - never judged me but gave me the tools to get better and live a less anxious life!  I had heard good reports about CBT but didn't know how it worked.  I can highly recommend Inclusion Thurrock's services and would say to anyone who is sceptical or worried about having therapy - don't be!  It can only help you and - in my experience - made me realise that I had been suffering from anxiety for a lot longer than I thought!  Don't put off the decision to have therapy - it really does help and all the staff at Inclusion Thurrock are amazing and so wonderful.

author: M C
title: Convenient Breast screening appointment
body: I got an appointment for a Sunday morning. I was met by friendly and welcoming staff. Had my screening done and it was quick friendly professional and easy. It was fantastic to have a weekend appointment as I didn’t have to take time off work snd the traffic to the hospital was at a minimal. Thank you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cassiopeiang95
title: Very very satisfied with the procedure
body: I had a procedure on my face today at Stirling Community Hospital. It was carried out by three members of staff, David, Angela and Rachel, and I was very very satisfied. It was on time, very professional, I was very happy with everything.

author: vegayk93
title: How important the virtual visiting service is
body: On Tuesday last I had to leave my dear friend at the door of Amber Resus never knowing if i would see her again as there is no visiting allowed in CAH at present.  My husband and I felt helpless, especially   when we tried to ring the Cardiac ward (1North) several times and no one answered. We understand the pressures but the level of helplessness for relatives is intolerable. We turned to the virtual visitimg service and this has been a wonderful lifeline.  When I spoke to Tara and Sylvia they were so  very compassionate and helpful.  I cannot praise this service and the people who man it enough.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Luna827
title: Miscarriages and not feeling listened to
body:
Hi , I am very upset with the hospital itself. During my time at the women’s hospital I have suffered 3 miscarriages altogether I have had 4. The first time I was told there was no heartbeat at 10 weeks pregnant the staff treated me with dignity and respect this is all before covid happened.  
Since covid I feel some staffs attitudes have seemed to of gone down hill. I suffered my third miscarriage through the women’s. I started bleeding and the doctor told me that I wasn’t having a miscarriage and the baby was in place. Then I suffered the miscarriage over the next couple of days.  
The next miscarriage I wanted to have a d&c to test the foetus for chromosome abnormalities so I had the operation and waited patiently for 2 months on test results. Guess what they failed to tell me they couldn’t get a sample and that there was no test results!  
This is completely unacceptable it’s a disgrace I wasn’t told any information for 2 whole months! Since then I have become pregnant again and I was incorrectly booked in for a scan date which I had already advised before they booked the scan that I was unavailable for certain dates so again I was not listened to.  
Further to that a consultant in the emergency department claimed that I am no longer with the miscarriage clinic since my 8 week scan was ok. I feel staff need to think about what they say to patients and give relevant information out instead of causing further anxiety as I am currently still with the miscarriage clinic and even they are unsure why the staff member said that to me.  
I feel like staff do not listen.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Gingey
title: My struggle with coping with the pandemic and alcohol and stress related issues
body:
I have been joining online morning groups with Kerry and My Key worker Lee for almost a year now . This group has helped me tremendously throughout the pandemic with my excessive drinking problem and Anxiety.  
Kerry is very supportive and understanding towards all members of the group and never judges or criticizes. Allows everyone to speak and share their experiences and is always ready to listen  
Lee is very helpful with everything that I have been through and is pretty much available anytime of the day to chat and give advice. When he says he will query something for me he always delivers. I have never been in this situation before and never claimed any kind of benefits before, Lee has been absolutely amazing in guiding me with my entitlements.  
The group on a whole is light hearted and fun whilst being very relaxing and full of ideas to help with all addictions.  
Kerry has an absolutely genius quiz master mode on a Friday which puts us in good spirits for the weekend  
Wouldn’t know what I would do to set me up for the day without these great guys.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Poor Service Mental Health
body: I am disgusted at the 4th time of visiting A & E by ambulance in a mental health crisis. I get treated like a prisoner, told to stay in a small room for 10 hours by a doctor and then get told to get off the premises with a security guard when I am suicidal they just let me leave.  The mental health nurses behaviours change and I wanted them to be more sympathetic when I am suicidal. Do not go to Lister hospital if your suicidal because they do not help, listen. I wanted to be sectioned but all she gave me was a leaflet.   They never gave my medication back so I have none now. I am appalled at the service, how am I meant to get better when the very people I go to are stopping me.

author: castordq59
title: My Fathers ‘care’ in ward C.. Morriston Hospital
body:
Absolutely horrified to hear how my Father was treated in Ward C October 2021. Video footage proves the incompetent care given. I feel lies were told and truth not reported. Shocking, absolutely shocking care of a 95 year old man. I feel that cameras need to be installed over all beds in the wards with log in details for close family members. Big Sister needs to be awake 24/7..  
Am totally appalled. This is 2021 not 1921....

author: Dalmatian
title: Extremely impressive department
body: My consultation with this Dept. proved to be extremely impressive. The care and attention was absolutely fastidious, professional and compassionate. The examination was very thorough, and the conclusions and follow-up actions explained very thoroughly at the time and in a subsequent note to my G.P. I am very grateful for the care and attention received and would heartily recommend the staff and Dept. concerned.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: nitratepb55
title: Service and care
body: From the moment I arrived at BAU Urology  at Firth Valley Royal Hospital, I  received exceptional care, helpful and done with a smiling face and genuine politeness. From being  seen early, as Donna in reception area 4, noticed I was in some discomfort and arranged a nurse to see me early, to Margaret who did a through check on my well being. I  also noticed a Doctor in another area show genuine politeness to a patient.

author: outflowsp68
title: Managing fatigue
body:
I found Karen's phone call every 2 weeks very helpful. Even if something wasn't on my mind, it always came up in the phone call and Karen was able to answer it.
I found the sheets and self assessment Karen sent to me a wealth of knowledge, they really helped with my breathing and fatigue, I will keep them forever and always refer back to them.

Thank you again Karen.

author: Recuperating sepsis survivor
title: 17 year old trying to reschedule COVID vaccine appointment
body:
My grandson needed to reschedule his 2nd dose vaccine appointment. Within his vaccine letter it states this can be done online so he registered online and tried to reschedule. No appointments despite trying all dates to November at 4 different sites on any day at any time.  
Called the helpline and while waiting to speak to someone one of the recorded messages states: If you are over 18 you can change your appointment online. Why would this information not come up online when you register with your date of birth? Why do you need to be 18 to reschedule online?  
My grandson couldn’t hold on the line long enough to speak to someone so I did. Spoke to a really nice girl who didn’t know you had to be 18 to reschedule online. She apologised for being unable to reschedule his appointment because it needs to be from 18 October onwards. These appointments have not been released yet.  
I also listened to the recorded messaging telling people to check social media for drop in sites. I did so and there were none in Greater Glasgow and Clyde today.

author: inspiregk34
title: Compassion showed at a difficult time
body:
Unfortunately after private early scans I was referred to the Rubislaw ward for an internal scan. I cannot praise the ward enough for the outstanding care and treatment I received. Dr Littlewood did my scan and along with the health care support worker they made me feel so at ease, unfortunately I was found to have a pregnancy with no heartbeat. This is never nice news to deliver or receive but it was done with so much compassion, nothing felt rushed and Dr Littlewood took time in explaining everything she did along the way.  
After my scan it was then to discuss treatment options, one of the midwives took time with myself and my partner explaining everything. It was made very clear if at any time once we went home and changed our minds about what option we had chosen that day we could just phone and talk to someone on the ward. We never felt pushed into making a specific treatment decision and felt it was very person centered care.  
A couple of days following I went into the ward for my treatment and was there for over 24 hours. Sorry I can't remember everyone's names but all the healthcare support workers and midwives on shift all did an amazing job. Whenever I needed anything from painkillers to advice it was always on hand. I had to stay in for further treatment as my first didn't work but again it was my choice on what I wanted to do and no one pushed me into making a decision it was what I felt was right for me.  
In such an awful time for myself and my partner the staff at Rubislaw couldn't have done anymore to make the horrible experience any easier and I can't thank you all enough.

author: phoenixrw57
title: Was kept well informed at Craigavon
body:
I was kept well informed and looked after the whole time I was in Craigavon Area Hospital. The medical team was very pleasant and they spent plently of time explaining things to me.  
The bed is comfy and the staff are very attentive and are quick at cleaning and changing the bed sheets. There are a range of food options too which is nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tracey45
title: My daughters mental health
body: My daughter has contacted on 8 separate occasions in the last year as she was feeling extremely low and felt her medication needed reviewed as it hadn’t been reviewed in over a year, each time she was told someone will get back to her. After numerous calls eventually the on call nurse did get back to her round about July time so she kindly arranged an appointment for a telephone consultation for the beginning of September, only for it to be cancelled the day before and once again we have heard nothing further about a new appointment. Myself and my daughter feels very let down by this service as the lack of support has been very poor. I feel for others like her who are experiencing the same issues but don’t have the support of their family like my daughter has.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: pictorje99
title: So easy to talk to
body: I have been coming to the Stafford sexual Health clinic for several years. They have always been so professional and polite and helpful. I can’t say enough for how I have valued their help. They are non judgemental and it is so easy to talk to them about what is all too often a taboo subject. Thank you!!!!!

author: cubefs99
title: Communication has been good
body: I arrived in to the emergency department where I waited for around 7 and a half hours which was not ideal. Waiting times could be improved. But once on the ward I have been very happy with my care. I've not a bad word to say about the nurses they'd help you sort anything you asked for. Communication has been good regarding my care. I also received transport in an ambulance to Craigavon for an MRI scan which was a great service. My only critisiscm would be there's not a good variety for food options. It is often only a choice between the same 2 options.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: starmr45
title: Laid back staff
body: Today the staff feel more laid back than yesterday as I felt less cared for however I understand how busy they are especially today. My room is clean. The food is so so.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: waltzbs83
title: Nothing but brilliant
body:
I suffered a fall at home and lost power in my legs and back which were very sore. I knew I was getting worse so felt reassured once I was placed on 3 North. The staff here have been nothing but brilliant and I have no criticism at all. Whilst in hospital I have felt I sleep better, eat better and also rest very well.  
Overall I am more than happy with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: echosh83
title: Fantastic overall
body:
I have had a fantastic experience here and any time I've called for help they've been to me within 5 minutes. The staff are on the button here and are very pleasant, providing me with the information I need. However, I asked for morphine as I really really needed something for pain relief but they didn't give me any. I understand why they may not have.  
I have also asked to speak to a dietician however this request has not been fulfilled.  
I was also in AMU and orthopedics and staff were good. I liked AMU as they don't beat around the bush and get things done quickly and efficiently.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Pongo57
title: Flu vaccination
body: I am a new patient with the Hockley Practice and had my flu vaccination this morning .Absolutely seamless. The booking system was slick, the reception staff were welcoming and engaging, the waiting room was akin to a 4 star hotel, and Karen, who administered the jab, was both personable and professional. Top job

author: elephantxk67
title: Provided with emotional support
body: I am attending Craigavon Area Hospital as I have MS and have been diagnosed with spasms in my neck. I did have a complaint however the staff have listened and are going to resolve this issue for me. Most of the staff are fantastic here especially the healthcare assistant Karen who has provided me with emotional support and reassurance.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: velars76
title: Staff all very kind
body: I had a hospital appointment with the Omagh Primary Care Centre radiology, and it was first class. The nurses and all staff were all very kind, and extremely eager to help, more than helpful

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
Easily booked a face to face appointment and have always managed this over many years
Doctor really approachable and kind and down to earth and sensible

author: melonmj67
title: Above and beyond
body:
The staff here do an absolutely amazing job. They are so caring, friendly and accomodating. They go above and beyond for me and are just fantastic. They keep me up to date with everything and carry out great work.  
The food is excellent here and the facilities are always clean and they are very accessible.  
I unfortunately had a long wait in A&E for 10 hours but other than this I am extremely happy with the care i'm receiving. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lovewz96
title: I couldn't wish for better care
body: I've just had treatment at the radiology department at North Devon District Hospital and it was absolutely amazing, a wonderful treatment, everyone was wonderful and caring and efficient. My procedure was dealt with in an amazing way, I could not fault it. I didn't want to be going through a procedure like that, but If I have to, I couldn't wish for better care.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: footballxr46
title: Everyone was smashing
body:
I attended minor operations in the Dermatology Department At Stirling Day Centre at the end of September. I had a minor procedure done on my face, removing little bits on three places.  
I just have to say it was all well done, everyone was smashing. There was a slight delay with the appointment due to an earlier appointment gone on too long or something, the staff were very apologetic but it didn't put me out.  
There were 6 people in the room with me, I can't remember their names, but they were all exceptionally nice. The letter I have here names Pamela, Sharon and Angela, but there was more of them in the room, and I wanted to make sure they all got the feedback they deserved as they were all so great

author: yankeecm67
title: Thankyou!
body: Thankyou to Tara and Sylvia and all at the virtual visiting who arrange the calls for family and patients. This is a lifeline for families especially when there is no or restricted visiting in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dickdoc
title: Unnecessary waiting time
body:
I made an appointment for mid afternoon on a Saturday at the beginning of October and arriving 10 mins early I joined the queue outside for 20+ mins. Eventually I arrived at the vaccination point (the place where I received my jab) over an hour after my appointment. There were some elderly folk who were being helped out of the queue because standing for that length of time was making them somewhat unsteady. By the time I left the queue outside was twice as long and it was raining hard. Please don’t get me wrong, the staff and volunteers at the centre were excellent and very professional.  
The point is that this is not an appointment service. Whoever is making the appointments hasn’t got a clue. It’s not rocket science to know how many jabs are given per hour, allow for a couple of DNA’s and make the appropriate number of appointments. It would relieve the stress on staff and patients.  
You’ve got 9 months experience of this. You should be able to sort this aspect out.  
Thank you for allowing my gripe and for the booster jab.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unacceptable Service
body: This practise still has its doors locked.  The times for 'doing things' are extremely limited.  e.g. one hour to collect/drop off forms, samples, very limited time on phone to get test results.  Telephone queues are mind boggling (e.g. my partner on phone for 50 minutes holding).  Need to bang loudly on the door to get a response (sometimes).  The pharmacy is not accessible. This is unacceptable!  The practise needs to have its doors opened and people should be able to enter, with a mask, socially distanced, limited number at a time, and speak to receptionists and interact as normal.  Yes, some appointments should be telephone/e-consult and some face to face, but the 'operation' of this building must be brought into line with the rest of NHS services.  Vulnerable and elderly people and those not on line are not being served by this GP practise.

author: JayneC
title: Supported by the wonderful maternity services
body:
I had a great pregnancy but when I went into labour over a week late, I was having a lot of pain. The Dundee Midwifery unit let me come in and be seen and reassured me all was ok. Then later I had some bleeding and called triage, they asked me to come in, and were very supportive and reassuring. Half way through my observation my little boys heart rate dropped and I was rushed to an emergency C section. The whole staff team were so calm and caring and explained everything that was happening during one of the scariest moments of my life. The head charge nurse even went back out to explain everything to my husband and reassure him.  
The surgery went well and again the staff kept both me and my husband calm and informed throughout. Unfortunately my son had some complications and wasn’t taking in enough oxygen and was taken to the NICU to get extra help. The team there were amazing also in keeping us reassured that when we couldn’t be with him he was being looked after and held.  
It was a very hard birth and a very scary moment for us as first time parents. But the entire staff team from when we first arrived at Dundee hospital until we left a few days later were so supportive and wonderful.  
Then after we got gone from hospital we had major issues with breastfeeding, he wouldn’t latch and was screaming in hunger. We received great support from our community midwife and the breast feeding team to try and resolve the issue. Unfortunately nothing seemed to help but the team we supportive to transferring to bottle feeding and provided reassurance and help regarding that and didn’t make me feel like I was a failure or wrong for having to stop breast feeding.

author: cetustw56
title: Appointments v's drop ins
body: I turned up with my 15 year old son for his covid vaccination appointment which was at 17.38 at DW Sports , Unit 54, Kingsgate Shopping Centre, Dunfermline. We had the appointment letter and turned up a little before appointment time. There was a very large queue in the shopping centre. It became apparent that the people in front of us did not have appointments. We went to the doorway. The NHS staff member told us we could go in but would join the walk ins it is now 7pm and my son has finally had his vaccination! It has ridiculous that we had to wait so very long with walk ins when had an appointment. The nurses were pleasant but I feel it was very badly organised today. Most disappointing.

title: Wonderful Hospital
body: I attend Dorking Hospital every few months for review. I had to attend last Saturday for a minor operation. What a relaxing experience being looked after by the Dermatology. They explained everything and made me feel like an individual, not just another patient. The staff of this hospital are a credit to the NHS. Thank you.

author: bargainkf97
title: Very helpful staff
body: I have had a very positive experience and I can't complain as all of the staff were brilliant. I had a long labour lasting 28 hours and the staff from the assessment centre to theatre and the delivery suite were all very helpful and were good at communicating. The midwife Patricia was very nice and she was with me at many tunes throughout my labour. Dr Lynsey come up to the ward to check on my baby as forceps were used and wanted to make sure that all was okay. This was a lovely touch. The food is good and there are good portion sizes. One thing that could be changed is to have a teapot of tea instead of only getting a small cup. It would be nice to be able to get a heat up of tea as mine sometimes goes cold as it has been left for a while if I'm busy with my baby. The ward is very warm but I brought my own fan in to try and help. Staff are accomodating and clear in terms of visiting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pepperjp64
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are all fantastic
body: I have had a great experience at hospital. The staff are all fantastic and my care has been very good. The doctors were very down to earth which I think is excellent. The staff are very efficient and they work very hard. I have been in for 3 weeks and the ward is lovely and quiet and I have been very comfortable. The only thing that I don't like too much food and there's always so much when it comes but this is only a small issue and apart from that I have had a super time in hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: eaglerf93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very helpful
body: The hospital staff were very helpful, kept an eye on me and looked after me well. The staff were also very nice and communicated well with me. The food is lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: victorfs37
title: Doctors couldn't have been nicer
body:
My experience overall was positive. The doctors couldn't have been nicer, the cardiologist was super. The ambulance team were amazing. Communication was outstanding, all my questions were answered promptly I feel the hospital is a very safe space.  
I'm happy and content with my story.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mayte56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are nice
body: The staff are nice, they communicate well to me and keep me updated. My room is nice and clean however the bed can be uncomfortable as in it is hard and you can stick to it but I am able to cope.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: scorecardpr76
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Midwifery led unit
body:
My experience in midwifery led unit.  
All staff have been great, the whole process was done quickly. Things moved much more smoothly in MLU compared to other units like the delivery suite that i've been in before. A midwife brought me some Jasmine oil in the room, I appreciated this small act.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: vulpeculawc48
title: Nurses and doctors are wonderful
body:
The staff are very friendly and accepting, my treatment doesn't textbook it feels unique. The nurses and doctors are wonderful, they are very reassuring and caring. The nurses in particular are fantastic, it feels as if you know them and they are great at listening to you, they aren't appreciated enough.  
My room is clean and comfy. The food is great there is a good choice. It isnt too noisy and waiting times aren't too long.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: leopardee74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I was kept well informed
body:
I have had a positive experience during my stay and have had no problems.  
The doctors were good however I would have liked them to communicate with my family a bit more as I am not good at explaining stuff to them.  
I was taken quite quickly in A&E and only had to wait a while for tests results. I was kept well informed throughout the process.  
The hospital food is grand and they give good portion sizes. The room i'm in is first class. It is like home from home and I had my own en suite which was great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: I am left speechless after my experience with…
body: I have been waiting for over a week to become registered only to find out (after calling the surgery myself) that despite living 1.5mile away from the practice I cannot be registered as I am out of their territory. Why did nobody checked my post code on registration form when I brought it to the surgery nor why nobody called me about this is beyond me.

title: Receptionist in dire need of interpersonal skills…
body: I called into the Bethseda surgery today, queued up and asked very politely if I could possibly use their toilet as I was having a bit of an emergency (very embarrassing to have to do this anyway). I wasn't expecting a yes necessarily - even after I'd explained that I suffer from Crohn's disease - but the response from the scowling receptionist was appallingly rude: 'What?! No, you can't! It's not a convenience!' she snapped (and repeated after I explained I have IBD and would not have called in otherwise). I really think this surgery needs to send its staff for some kind of customer service training or else replace that member of staff with someone a bit better equipped to deal with the public. Really disgusting behaviour from someone who should know better. Even if the surgery's policy is to refuse toilet access to someone with Inflammatory Bowel Disease, there is such a thing as doing it COURTEOUSLY. "Sorry, the toilet is for patients' use only" would have bene a perfectly acceptable reply. Maybe she could try it next time?

author: echonk86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Considerate staff
body:
Everything about my experience in Craigavon Area Hospital is positive. The A+E staff were lovely and everything was communicated well to me, I had no waiting time I got straight through and into bed.  
I was moved to 1 North this morning which has better facililties, the staff are super, they are helpful, jolly and considerate. They brought me a nice comfortable chair. The ward couldn't be better and my room is lovely.  
The staff recognise me from a previous visit which makes me feel more comfortable and welcomed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Can't get through, can't get appointments
body: Waste of time, can't get through to the reception over the phone, can't book appointments online because of paperwork requirements, overall unhelpful. Can't form an opinion on the medical staff as we never got to see any of them.

title: Great Service
body: Went for flu jab for 1st time, time taken out by nurse to go through potential side effects and really efficient service.

title: Rapid flue vaccination!
body: My wife and I attended the surgery for our annual flu vaccination. We arrived a couple of minutes early and were back outside, vaccination complete, in under 5 minutes. Thanks to everyone in the Practice who made this so amazingly efficient - whilst at the same time somehow being friendly!

title: Great Practice
body: Phone appointment booked via Internet,  all worked very smoothly. I have been with the Practice for 43 years and have seen it grow and progress. I have always been treated very well by all staff and Doctors. I have now moved 3.2 miles from the Surgery and am totally disappointed that I have been told I have to find a new Practice. Very very disappointed and will miss the quality and friendly help I have always received, together with the Doctors I have trusted and relied upon. Very sorry to be leaving.

title: Doctor/patient interaction via e consult option
body:
The present system is not a proper or effective consultation. The patient has limited facility for describing his/her symptoms in writing and so the 
response from the doctor is literally based on how well you have described your symptoms and concerns. Also, if  you want to correct the doctor’s assumptions or provide more information it is not possible to do so without logging on again, and waiting for another day.

title: Great practice
body: My visit today was for the flu jab.  The staff were welcoming and well organised. Very efficient service. Thank you to everyone involved.

title: Disregard for concerns of family members
body:
Despite numerous attempts to gain urgent care for my elderly mother I was ignored and told not to call the practice as I was not "next of kin".
The next of kin was suffering issues and struggling to care for her himsepf hence I was trying to intervene and avoid another hospital visit for my mother.
I was spoken to like a naughty child and told to stop calling the practice. I believe my mother suffered as a result.

title: Great staff
body: Was seen to pretty quickly about 45 minutes wait which I didn't think was bad. I'd cut my finger pretty bad. Got seen too quite quick I thought. The doctor was friendly and easy to talk too, butterfly stitched my cut and dressed it and I had a tetanus jab too by another person because of the wound. In total I was there maybe 1 hour 45 minutes which is good.

author: The Ballroom
title: Cancelled operation for 2nd time
body:
I post this on behalf of my wife who is now in floods of tears.  
Today she received a call from ENT Inpatients to cancel her operation for a 2nd time because there is no theatre staff. Now the Surgeon (her surgeon) as we speak is in theatre doing surgery.  
She is angry and upset as now this is the 2nd time she has had to take time off work and arrange childcare work commitments and aftercare arrangements, for the hospital to cancel less than 24 hours before the surgery is due. 3 years she has been waiting now, and to get to less than 24 hours prior and they cancel again. When I have contacted NHS Tayside for a name of someone to contact they can't give me any info and say I have to email into a generic email address and response will be 5 working days stage 1. The complaints department has been a WASTE of time as all they say is I don't know, I won't know that, and so on.  
Please do not use coronavirus as a get-out. We have been told the space is there but that they don't have the staff. Really.

author: statusjw47
title: Addressed every concern
body: Today I was seen in EPAC as I was experiencing some pelvic pain. From start to finish I was amazed by the professionalism, compassion and care shown by the three nurses. Especially the lady who scanned me, Angela, who spent so much time with me, explaining everything and addressing every concern I had. I really felt as if she truly cared about me and how I was feeling… having experienced a previous loss and going through fertility treatment, the way she treated me was exactly what I needed at that time. I just want to say thank you, as the EPAC team went above and beyond for me, and having been through so much trauma surrounding pregnancy previously, being cared for by people like Angela makes such a huge difference.

author: Boodles
title: Womb biopsy appointment
body: Having previously had a bad experience in a local doctors surgery for a simple smear test, I was not looking forward to having a gyno check & womb biopsy taken. In fact, I was trying not to shake. The ladies (I'm afraid I can't remember their names) made me feel totally at ease from the start & I can't thank them enough.

title: Very Impressed
body: I’ve had 2 appointments in the past month - x-ray and ultra sound and on both appointments I was seen before my appointment time. The hospital is well sign posted for each department, it looks clean and all of the staff I spoke to were very friendly.

title: Excellent Treatment
body: I visited the GWH for a chest xray on the 29th of September 2021. The treatment and the respect I received was first class. The staff were very friendly, professional and approachable and I couldn't have asked for better treatment so thank you very much.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very grateful to be a patient of Keats practice
body: I have always been treated in a very caring and professional manner by the doctors and all the other staff, and have always been treated in such a respectful manner.

title: Fantastic nurse
body:
visited WGH A&E department this evening with my daughter who had a fractured finger, I was miss informed by 111 who told me we had an appointment to see a GP at 8.40pm and had to sit and wait for 4 long hours as it was incredibly busy and as people are seen by priority rather than arrival time which is completely acceptable.
We were dealt with by one of the nicest Nurse practitioners who was dealing with arriving triage she was an absolute delight and nothing was to much trouble a real asset to our NHS thank you nurse M I am gutted I am not allowed to post this with your name as you really do deserve the recognition.

title: Uncaring and rude
body:
My experience with this Surgery has been terrible. The receptionists are incredibly rude and you feel as if you are a burden to them. I understand that due to covid they are supposed to screen people more and seem to only give appointments to emergency situations, as this is due to no doctors available? and I don’t mean they are just busy, I mean I was told there was literally no doctors working and if there was there was only 1 doctor. 
The customer care I have experienced at this Surgery is sub par and not acceptable. This has been a very stressful time for everyone, however this is not an excuse to treat patients terribly when they call needing help.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great flu clinic
body:
Dear everyone at old school surgery
thank you so much for your flu clinic today where I took my dad. We were both vaccinated within a minute of arriving and everybody was so kind. Greeted by smiling people outside and smiling people inside. It was so nice for my dad who is quite frail and wobbly these days. 

So thank you to everybody and best wishes.

title: Maternity services.
body:
Second pregnancy has been very different to the first with more visits to Broomfield than before. It's a shame that the 'follow up' appointment I had for an extra growth scan took a total of two hours (most sitting out in the corridor) and made to feel like no one knew why I was there and also that I should know what this extra appointment was for and what would be said. 
The main desk staff didn't seem like they really wanted to help either. And when I asked a question regarding appointments as advised by the doctor I saw it was like getting blood from a stone for an answer.
Nothing seems very clear which is making me very wary for the birth.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: once the finest- not so in my experience!
body:
i will not shout with capital letters but will shout thus with little letters.

my visit began in severe pain entering the urgent care unit and i exit after being seen in severe pain. i was not offered any pain relief during my 2 1/2 hour wait or neither when screened and seen by a practitioner. after a brief examination, i got a script i asked the practitioner who dealt with me where in the hospital the pharmacy was situated she said there wasn't one.i asked where then, could i get my antibiotics for what is a severe infection and she just said outside. that was it...'outside' i walked outside onto the street and found no pharmacy open. i looked on google and i was directed to watney market for a supposidely 24hr pharmacy but it was shut. i was in deep distress because i was still in pain, alot of pain actually

the toilets in the urgent care department for visitors and attendees was disgraceful, filthy, no soap to wash your hands and nothing to wipe your hands with or neither a dryer there, the floor was covered with soggy wet toilet tissue and the floor was dirty.


as a person attending for urgent care i waited around 2 and a half hours, which is pretty good going for a urgent care unit so no complaints about that

my gripes are about the production line aspect of terribly quick screening without any real dig into examination (e.g., i was expecting some kind of x ray to be honest) anyway regardless i got a prescription for antibiotics, great but nowhere in fact to get those because the hospital didn't or so i was told have a pharmacy and i could not find one as instructed 'outside' to find a pharmacy that was  open for business. i am upset and i am not happy to be a, left in severe discomfort and b, without any way of being able to get my medication as prescribed.

i travelled home in pain and then had to self medicate with pain relief.


one unhappy individual

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Awful practice
body: This has to be the worst practice in Essex. I have to keep ringing and ringing until you eventually get through to be told sorry ring tomorrow we are fully booked!!! Just book appointments for next week its so simple but as usual the NHS and surgery's refuse to change. Its like it or lump attitude isn't patient centred nor is it constructive.

title: Thank you
body: I wanted to say thank you for the GP seeing me face to face because I hear on the news yes otherwise. I feel much better and more relieved. It was easy to get through on the phones.

title: Flu Jab
body:
I had the flu jab on Saturday 2 October. The entire procedure was quick, efficient and well organised.
The 2 ladies who dealt with me were delightful, with smiles, warmth and friendly chatter.
Thank you.

title: Great practice and outstanding care
body: The appointment for my daughter yesterday with the GP was exceptional.  The doctor was so kind, friendly and professional and the care recieved was excellent.  Clearly a GP who had a wealth of knowledge and experience and was confident to do their job well.

title: Great practice and outstanding care
body: The appointment recently for my daughter with the GP was outstanding.  The inital phone conversation was helpful and within the agreed time and the follow up appointment was great.  The GP was kind, friendly, thorough and professional.  The care we received was exceptional and done with such a lovely tone for a child.  We were reassured and given great advice and clearly the GP had a wealth of knowledge and experience and the confident manner in which they used this was outstanding.  Thank-you.

title: Quick effective receptionists
body: Called in for an appointment and the receptionist was quick and effective for a same day phone consultation.

title: Best practice I have been patient of
body: Most of the staff I have had to see have been patient and also friendly ,This under the sress we are under with health problems is very much appreciated.Thank you.

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
The service provided was first class from the moment you arrive till you leave, you  are treated with dignity and respect .
Nothing is to much for the staff they look after you  and care for your every need.
Can not praise the Spa medica group and staff enough.

title: Amazing
body: They deserve the outstanding they received from CQC... my God what an amazing team.. very efficient. Thank you St Richards Hospital, A&E in particular.. I'm forever grateful for your help. You know feeling better before even starting treatment

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu Clinic
body: Another brilliantly organised flu clinic from the friendly team at the surgery. My 95 year old father was in and out in less than 5 minutes and had nothing but praise for all the staff involved. Great doctors and nurses and great reception staff too!

title: Thank you for being so kind
body: I was admitted by ambulance on a blue light when my heart started beating dangerously fast.  I was so well looked after by such dedicated, kind doctors and nurses.  They made me feel like I was in good hands they were truly amazing on the resuscitation unit, they went out of their way to reassure me despite being very busy.  When I think back to that day I feel so grateful for their kindness and professionalism.  I write this as I don’t think they know just how brilliant they are.  I guess it’s what they do day in and day out, but for me, Barnet General is where I want to be if I need to be treated in a hospital.  Well done to everyone who looked after me on that day I truly appreciate you all - THANK YOU!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient & well organised practice
body: I attended for my over-65's 'Flu jab. The appointment was notified to me by text message which was good. Previous appointment was cancelled because of a shortage of the vaccine but done so in good time so no inconvenience was caused. There was a queue of people but that was to be expected. The actual jab was handled quickly and efficiently in less than a minute. Great service! Well done.

title: Excellent Treatment
body:
I am extremely impressed with both the standard of treatment and care that I have received.  Both the consultant and his staff have been so helpful, considerate and kind to me during my visits to them.
I was so grateful that they put on extra clinics on a Sunday to reduce the wait that myself and other patients would have had.

title: Very well organised flu jabs
body: Brief waiting time; patients organised efficiently into distanced lines; pleasant doctor and support staff. Five stars!

title: Happy with The Yorkshire Clinic - it were a reyt…
body: From the beginning of my assessment to the completion of my treatment I can only say I was treated in a superb manner.  All the staff behaved in a professional way and treated me with kindness and courtesy.

title: Very helpful practice
body:
All members of the practice are more than friendly, pleasant and put themselves out to be helpful and understanding. 
My thanks to them all.

title: Everything has been excellent
body: I found it so good, everything has been excellent.  Everybody has been kind, helpful and so good.  The nurses have been very good.

title: A very good experience
body: Booked my daughter in. Rang up on Monday and got an appointment for Tuesday. They explained about building works and where the alternative entrance was. The Dr was great with my daughter, letting her explain what had happened, talking her through what she could see and had a very friendly and approachable demeanor. We were quickly prescribed an antibiotic cream, that was sent straight through to the chemist. A very good experience.

author: EricaF
title: The team were exceptional
body: I entered the Minster Ward for a minor procedure today. The team on duty this morning including Dr Rees, the consultant were exceptional. I am sorry that I don’t know the names of staff who were on duty. I was treated with dignity and respect. As an ethnic minority I felt really good about the way I was treated. The team were really caring about their respective roles, thoroughly professional. I want to say a big thank you. People like you make a difference.

title: Fantastic GP
body: Thanks to the new GP, absolute Star !  Sorted out my tablets and helped get them all ordered for the same day each month

title: Care that is a positive experience for patients
body:
This was a quality objective in the Worcestershire Hospitals Quality Improvement Strategy 2018-2019.
In this regard I can report that I enjoyed a very positive experience. The support consideration and assurance provided to me during my scalp skin cancer surgery by the surgeon and the support staff was outstanding.

title: Rapid referral
body:
I was very impressed with the prompt telephone call back I had in April by the practice nurse for a hand problem. I was telephoned 2 hours after my email enquiry and was referred to a private specialist who received my referral the next day. Really efficient.
Thank you Cobham Health centre, in my opinion GPs and their teams do not deserve the negative press they are getting.

title: Rapid referral
body:
I was very impressed with the prompt telephone call back I had in April by the practice nurse for a hand problem. I was telephoned 2 hours after my email enquiry and was referred to a private specialist who received my referral the next day. Really efficient.
Thank you Cobham Health centre, in my opinion GPs and their teams do not deserve the negative press they are getting.

title: excellent care and attention
body: Thank you to a wonderful NHS team - receptionists, endoscopist, nurses specialists, colorectal surgeon, and medical staff for excellent care and attention during my recent experience with Bucks NHS.  I am so grateful to have received such wonderful treatment, delivered with empathy, compassion and patience.

title: Outstanding treatment
body: Cannot fault the whole team who are caring, considerate, amenable and efficient. They took time and patience to determine the cause of the problem. Charming young female opthalmologist, who was at great pains to find an effective treatment. Bravo to everyone there.

title: Thank you!
body: I just wanted to say thank you to all the different staff who looked after me this morning in the ED & AEC. They were all very helpful, reassuring and made sure I saw the right people at the right time. I am very grateful for all the assistance I received!

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: JYM669
title: Excellent care by A&E and ENT
body:
I took my Mum to A&E at Monklands when she developed a heavy, unstoppable nosebleed due to her being on anticoagulant medication. Although the wait was 4 hours she was seen within 45minutes and treated quickly and efficiently by the staff there. Everyone was extremely courteous and took good care of her. She was admitted to ward 9 after a few hours and kept in for 2 days, she was seen by the ENT doctor and had some vessels cauterised before being discharged with antibiotics. I was told to take her straight back to A&E if it happened again.  
That same night the bleeding started again so back we went to A&E, again we were seen in less than an hour. This time after having bloods taken we were sent to the ENT treatment room, here we were seen by specialist nurse Frank. My Mum was instantly put at ease by his caring attitude and of course a bit of banter. He was extremely thorough and said he'd try his best to make sure she didn't need to be admitted again. We were there for nearly 2 hours while he cleaned and cauterised another vessel and re-packed her nostril. He also gave us some good advice to try and prevent it happening again. After checking her blood work we were good to go, everyone was lovely that we met but special thanks to Frank in the ENT treatment room.

author: Kitty54
title: Unexpected trip to ED
body:
My husband had an accident yesterday and cut his finger off! Obviously quite a shock for him and a frightening experience. I took him directly to ED at The Ulster Hospital. Everyone we met on our journey from the receptionist, to the nurses, doctors and Consultant, were professional, calm and reassuring. My husband had cut through a small artery, and though this looked terrifying to him, he was treated promptly, appropriately, calmly and with care. He was given emergency treatment, given a tetanus injection, some antibiotics and his hand was dressed. We attended Plastics the next day for terminalisation of his finger. What an amazing service! Free at point of delivery by professional kind people. If anyone truly has an emergency and needs urgent treatment, the Ulster Hospital ED department is the place to go.  
Thank you everyone. Your care and genuine desire to help us was so appreciated. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
